fields.description:
Dear colleagues,
 
Embase customer reported that, there are no Entry date for Embase Article in Press records now.
 
I confirm that I cant find the AiP entry date for AiP records on Embase record details.
When I tried to export this date, I got a blank file.
 
The most strange thing is, even there is no AiP entry date for AiP records, the data filter still works. How it works?
Please see the screenshot below


As the entry date is very important to Embase customers, could you please be so kind and have a look at this as soon as possible?
 
Many thanks in advance.
 
Best Regards
Jessica

fields.description:
Steps done to reproduce:

1. Create a folder in S3(embase_dev) to process with 100 zip files to process.
2. Run the ingestion on those 100 files to check the amount of articles indexed .
3.  The no we got after indexing when everything was running fine was *1925931* - This is our baseline number

Now again,
1. Use the same folder and start the ingestion process again
2. Now, in between start the failover testing and put one of the kafka nodes down(The logic is that the replica of the kafka which is created will take the load of it and the ingestion will not stop or fail)
3. Check the number of articles. - we got *1925627* articles indexed


So now, we have a difference of *304* articles. Ideally it should have been the same.

Could we investigate it to why this happened.
fields.summary: Kafka management- When kafka nodes go down there is discrepancy in the no of articles indexed

fields.description:
In the currents logs we can see that even simple queries start degrading. Right now we can only detect issues when it's already too late, when queries really fail.
The proposal is to run a simple query regularly. It should normally take few miliseconds. As soon as it starts taking more that 60 seconds, this would be an indication that the system is degrading. This would allow us to anticipate and act before the server actually crashes

fields.description:
h5.The only interface to interact with ES/K8S authors cluster is author search endpoint - *emb_url/rest/author/search*
# performance test suite is prepared (/)
# the plan to run it versus several ES/K8S setups with different amount of users (in progress)

h5.Ownership:
Embase testing team + devopses to change the settings for different test scenarios


h5.User amount based scenarios:
# ramp up by 5 users up to 50 over 5 sec and keeping the load up to 30 mins
# ramp up by 5 users up to 100 over 5 sec and keeping the load up to 30 mins
# ramp up by 5 users up to 150 over 5 sec and keeping the load up to 30 mins

h5.Different shards and availability zones scenarios:
{noformat}
First run:
Java:
 - 16GB Heap size
 - Processors: 8
Elasticsearch: 
- 8 Processors
Data Nodes:
- m5.2xlarge (32Gbyte ram)
- Two Availability zones
- 5 Data Nodes on each Zone
- 1 Replica on each shard
- All Indices Open (articles and Author)
{noformat}
https://jira.elsevier.com/secure/attachment/151815/1.zip

{noformat}

Data Nodes:

- 1 Replica on each shard
- All Indices Open (articles and Author)
{noformat}

!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

Data Nodes:

- Two Availability zones

fields.description:
h5.May usage report for 3 main events related to author search page which will be moved under ES/K8S:
*em:emtree:emtree:other:2.3 authors* - Author search page opening event
*em:emtree:emtree:other:2.3.1 find author* - 'Find author' button click event (main ES/K8S event we are interested in)
*em:emtree:emtree:other:2.3.2 find articles by these authors* - 'Find articles by this authors' button click event (sends request to execute search in ML)
 !image-2019-06-05-13-02-31-231.png|thumbnail!

So as a conclusion 1k author searches per month is pretty low load.

fields.description:
{noformat}
Hi Iaroslav,

 

We had a brief chat with Boudewijn regarding to infrastructure related changes which are coming for Embase and the way on how to test it correctly.

I am going to put some short notes about how I would recommend to approach this.

Preparing phase:

    Collecting of planned system capacity numbers (like how many concurrent users planned/how many searches in a second/daily, amount of alerts to be sent). I think in general these points are clear from the statistics available, but I would also increase expectations to at least 20% ) 

Participants: PO, QE

Outcome of the meeting: collecting of non-functional requirements

Future steps: aligning performance tests with non-functional requirements

    Analysis of Infrastructure diagram (which is in place according to Boudewijn)

Participants: a focus group selected from BE, QE, devops departments

Outcome of that meeting is a test plan: list of services to emulate they get

    down/crushed
    lost network/not connected to some/any services
    overloaded 

Future steps: making performance tests microservice focused, so there is a way to load some of service(-s) independently

    Make sure infrastructural monitoring is in place for all these services and application health checks are a part of monitoring

 

Execution:

    Making sure system behaves as expected on new environment at planned load
    Have a session of testing according to test plan developed 

Participants: devops, QE

How to

    Monitoring/healthchecks shows each service is not working when it is down/lost network/overloaded
    Product behavior is documented (what user is seeing/what error appears)
    Steps of how to deal with each problem should be documented ( if something should be fixed automatically  this needs to be clearly identified )
    Time required for fixing each problem is documented (must have)

Outcome:  disaster recovery plan and runbooks for L1 support

 

In the future it will be possible to re-run tests when necessary to make sure the system behaves fine even after infrastructure-related changes.

 

Please decide who will be leading this project and pushing the team.

 

Thanks, Misha

{noformat}

fields.description:
On the 4th of June at 7:45 server time (UTC) our cluster started to experience high load. 

According to metrics all ML nodes consumed all available RAM and it caused very high IOPS on root volume.

To restore cluster functioning we had to reboot all ML nodes.

Screenshots from Grafana

 !image-2019-06-04-17-19-29-566.png|thumbnail! 

 !image-2019-06-04-17-20-03-688.png|thumbnail! 

ML logs for this time:

https://kibana6.cm-elsevier.com/app/kibana#/discover?_g=(refreshInterval:(pause:!t,value:0),time:(from:'2019-06-04T07:40:41.786Z',mode:absolute,to:'2019-06-04T08:00:41.786Z'))&_a=(columns:!(loglevel,ML_message),filters:!(('$state':(store:appState),meta:(alias:!n,disabled:!f,index:'embase_logs-*',key:app-type,negate:!t,params:(query:WEB,type:phrase),type:phrase,value:WEB),query:(match:(app-type:(query:WEB,type:phrase)))),('$state':(store:appState),meta:(alias:!n,disabled:!f,index:'embase_logs-*',key:source,negate:!f,params:(query:%2Fvar%2Fopt%2FMarkLogic%2FLogs%2FErrorLog.txt,type:phrase),type:phrase,value:%2Fvar%2Fopt%2FMarkLogic%2FLogs%2FErrorLog.txt),query:(match:(source:(query:%2Fvar%2Fopt%2FMarkLogic%2FLogs%2FErrorLog.txt,type:phrase)))),('$state':(store:appState),meta:(alias:!n,disabled:!f,index:'embase_logs-*',key:loglevel,negate:!t,params:(query:Info,type:phrase),type:phrase,value:Info),query:(match:(loglevel:(query:Info,type:phrase))))),index:'embase_logs-*',interval:auto,query:(language:lucene,query:''),sort:!('@timestamp',asc))

fields.customfield_10741: Daily deliveries to Bayer from Embase.com exports
fields.description:
As a user at Bayer, I would like to receive daily direct deliveries in the Embase.com export format.

To consider:
* current process: Bayer receives daily direct deliveries from Production. The Production format will not be relevant for them for their new internal system.
* They would like to receive as a one-off delivery the records added from the moment they received the full EMbase.com reload to the moment they start receiving daily deliveries
* where to place the deliveries (S3?) or deliver back to Production and use their process
* timing of the deliveries and of the exports (performance to consider?)
fields.summary: Daily deliveries to Bayer from Embase.com exports
